Detailed Description

Platform-dependent parser I/O routines header and definition.

Version:
$Id: cparser_io.h 142 2011-09-01 05:31:27Z henry $
CLI parser library requires some platform-dependent API to provide access to the terminal. These API can vary greatly among different OSs.

Definition in file cparser_io.h.

Typedef Documentation

typedef void(* cparser_getch_fn)(cparser_t *parser, int *ch, cparser_char_t *type)

Get a character input from the keyboard.

Parameters:
parser Pointer to the parser structure.
Return values:
ch Pointer to the returned character code.
type Type of the returned character. If it is CPARSER_CHAR_REGULAR, *ch holds the ASCII code.
Returns:
None.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum cparser_char_t

Character type return by cparser_getch().

Enumerator:
CPARSER_CHAR_UNKNOWN  Character that cannot be classified.
CPARSER_CHAR_REGULAR  All alpha-numeric + punctuation charcters.
CPARSER_CHAR_UP_ARROW  Up arrow (recall previous command).
CPARSER_CHAR_DOWN_ARROW  Down arrow (recall next command).
CPARSER_CHAR_LEFT_ARROW  Left arrow (prev.

character in the command)

CPARSER_CHAR_RIGHT_ARROW  Right arrow (next character in the command).
CPARSER_CHAR_FIRST  Go to the first character in the command.
CPARSER_CHAR_LAST  Go to the first character in the command.

Definition at line 43 of file cparser_io.h.
